causes: Clogged suction filter or inlet screen
Low oil level in rotary vane pump
Faulty or leaking gaskets and O-rings
actions: Perform leak detection using ultrasonic detector or soap bubble test
Inspect and clean or replace suction filters
Check and top up oil to recommended level
Drain contaminated oil and replace with manufacturer-recommended grade
Inspect vanes for wear and replace if clearance exceeds tolerance
Replace worn gaskets and O-rings
Verify pump capacity matches process demand

causes: Mechanical misalignment of coupling or shaft
Electrical overload due to high current draw
Blocked cooling fins or heat exchanger
actions: Inspect bearings for wear, noise, or play and replace if needed
Check and correct shaft alignment using dial indicator
Verify motor current draw against nameplate rating
Check cooling water inlet temperature and flow rate
Clean cooling fins and heat exchanger passages
Review duty cycle and reduce continuous operation time if needed

issue: Pump not running or failing to start
causes: Electrical supply failure or tripped breaker
Motor winding fault or burnt coil
Seized rotor due to corrosion or foreign object
actions: Verify incoming power supply and check breaker status
Test motor winding resistance using megger
Attempt manual rotation of shaft to check for seizure
Inspect contactor and relay for pitting or welding
Reset thermal overload relay and investigate cause
Check all interlocks and safety circuits in control panel

causes: Mechanical drag from worn bearings or misalignment
Oil viscosity too high for operating temperature
Process gas load exceeding pump design capacity
actions: Inspect bearings and coupling alignment
Verify oil grade matches manufacturer specification for ambient temperature
Measure gas throughput and compare with pump rating
Perform internal inspection for wear on vanes, rotor, and stator
Measure and balance three-phase voltage at motor terminals

issue: Oil contamination or low oil level
causes: Process gas condensation in oil reservoir
Oil drain plug or sight glass leaking
Wrong oil grade or mixing incompatible oils
actions: Install or verify gas ballast valve operation to reduce condensation
Inspect shaft seals and replace if damaged
Follow manufacturer oil change intervals strictly
Check drain plug torque and sight glass gasket condition
Drain system completely and refill with correct manufacturer-specified oil

issue: Abnormal noise or vibration during operation
causes: Loose mounting bolts or foundation issues
actions: Tighten all mounting bolts and inspect foundation for cracks
Replace worn bearings using manufacturer-specified replacements
Check inlet piping for restrictions or blockages
Disassemble pump and inspect chamber for debris
Inspect coupling and realign as per manufacturer tolerances

issue: Vacuum pump takes too long to reach setpoint
causes: Small leak in piping or vessel
Degraded pump performance due to wear
actions: Perform comprehensive leak test on entire vacuum circuit
Clean or replace inlet filter element
Compare current evacuation time against commissioning baseline
Evaluate whether additional pump capacity is required
Close gas ballast valve if condensation is not an issue

issue: Oil mist or fumes from exhaust
causes: Worn or saturated oil mist filter
Oil degradation due to high operating temperature
Exhaust filter housing cracked or gasket damaged
actions: Replace oil mist filter element
Drain oil to correct level as per sight glass marking
Check operating temperature and investigate root cause of overheating
Inspect exhaust filter housing and replace gasket if needed
